panels.title: pgbouncer_sync_primary_pool: Postgres Sync (Web/API/Git) primary Connection Pool Utilization per Node
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Postgres Sync (Web/API/Git) primary Connection Pool Utilization per Node

panels.content:
pgbouncer sync connection pool Saturation per database node, for primary database connections.

Web/api/git applications use a separate connection pool to sidekiq.

When this resource is saturated, web/api database operations may queue, leading to rails worker
saturation and 503 errors in the web.

panels.title: pgbouncer_async_primary_pool: Postgres Async (Sidekiq) primary Connection Pool Utilization per Node
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Postgres Async (Sidekiq) primary Connection Pool Utilization per Node

panels.content:
pgbouncer async connection pool utilization per database node, for primary database connections.

Sidekiq maintains it's own pgbouncer connection pool. When this resource is saturated,
database operations may queue, leading to additional latency in background processing.

Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.content: Disk space utilization per device per node.

panels.title: disk_inodes: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.content:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files

panels.title: open_fds: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.content:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.

panels.title: pgbouncer_client_conn_primary: PGBouncer Client Connections per Process (Primary)
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
PGBouncer Client Connections per Process (Primary)

panels.content:
Client connections per pgbouncer process for Primary connections.

pgbouncer is configured to use a `max_client_conn` setting. This limits the total number of client connections per pgbouncer.

When this limit is reached, client connections may be refused, and `max_client_conn` errors may appear in the pgbouncer logs.

This could affect users as Rails clients are left unable to connect to the database. Another potential knock-on effect
is that Rails clients could fail their readiness checks for extended periods during a deployment, leading to saturation of
the older nodes.

panels.title: pgbouncer_single_core: PGBouncer Single Core per Node
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
PGBouncer Single Core per Node

panels.content:
PGBouncer single core CPU utilization per node.

PGBouncer is a single threaded application. Under high volumes this resource may become saturated,
and additional pgbouncer nodes may need to be provisioned.

panels.title: shard_cpu: Average CPU Utilization per Shard
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.content:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.

panels.title: cpu: Average Service CPU Utilization
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.content:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries: conntrack Entries per Node
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
conntrack Entries per Node

panels.content:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".

panels.title: single_node_cpu: Average CPU Utilization per Node
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.content:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is saturated, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.

panels.title: memory: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.content: Memory utilization per device per node.

panels.title: node_schedstat_waiting: Node Scheduler Waiting Time
Saturation Severity
Scaling Characteristics
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Average Case
Tamland Predicted Threshold Violation, Pessimistic Case
Node Scheduler Waiting Time

panels.content:
Measures the amount of scheduler waiting time that processes are waiting
to be scheduled, according to [`CPU Scheduling Metrics`](https://www.robustperception.io/cpu-scheduling-metrics-from-the-node-exporter).

A high value indicates that a node has more processes to be run than CPU time available
to handle them, and may lead to degraded responsiveness and performance from the application.

Additionally, it may indicate that the fleet is under-provisioned.
Made with ❤️ and [Grafonnet](https://github.com/grafana/grafonnet-lib). [Contribute to this dashboard on GitLab.com](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/blob/master/dashboards)
